means: 屈尊，俯就( condescend的现在分词 )

sentence.Network_en: I'm fed up with your money and your whole condescending attitude.
sentence.Network_cn: 我讨厌你的钱，也受够了你居高临下的态度。

sentence.Network_en: They can be a bit condescending.
He has a condescending attitude towards women.
sentence.Network_cn: 他对女性总是居高临下。

entry.tran: 盛气凌人的;居高临下的
entry.def: If you say that someone is condescending, you are showing your disapproval of the fact that they talk or behave in a way which shows that they think they are superior to other people.

example.ex: I'm fed up with your money and your whole condescending attitude...
example.tran: 我讨厌你的钱，也受够了你居高临下的态度。

example.ex: They can be a bit condescending.

means.word_mean: 1. (used of behavior or attitude) characteristic of those who treat others with condescension

auth_sentence.content: What a condescending pish-posh; stay away from mysticism.
auth_sentence.res_content: What a condescending pish-posh; stay away from mysticism.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: What a condescending pish-posh; stay away from mysticism.

auth_sentence.content: Or I was snide and condescending toward her mother.
auth_sentence.res_content: Or I was snide and condescending toward her mother.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Or I was snide and condescending toward her mother.

auth_sentence.content: He was cold, aloof, condescending, ungrateful.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was cold, aloof, condescending, ungrateful.

sentences.en: I didn’t like his tone of voice; I felt he was being condescending.
sentences.cn: 我不喜欢他说话的腔调，我觉得他好像很屈尊一样。

means.word_mean: 表现出优越感的; 居高临下的

sentences.en: He tends to adopt a condescending manner when talking to young women.
sentences.cn: 和年轻女子说话时，他喜欢摆出一副高高在上的姿态。
